description:
The child of a Human father and Klingon mother, B’Elanna Torres spent her formative years growing up on the Federation colony Kessik IV. After her father left home while B’Elanna was still young, she grew resentful of her Klingon heritage, citing it as the reason for her father’s abandonment of his wife and child. After a brief tenure in Starfleet Academy, B'Elanna dropped out of her enrolment and spent a number of months in search of a different purpose. When a Bolian freighter she was traveling aboard was attacked by Cardassian forces, her life was saved by Commander Chakotay and the forces of the Maquis. This intervention motivated B’Elanna to enlist in the Maquis herself, inspired by her newfound purpose to fight back against the Cardassians.
In 2371, the SS Val Jean, along with B’Elanna and her fellow Maquis crew, was declared lost in the Badlands. In actuality, the vessel had been abducted by the Caretaker array and transported to the Delta Quadrant, along with the Federation starship Voyager. When the Val Jean was intercepted by Voyager, the Maquis crew were incorporated into Voyager’s roster. B’Elanna was among those assigned to the Engineering team, and was granted a provisional promotion to lieutenant junior grade.
Although reluctant to accept it in her rebellious youth, B’Elanna was a brilliant engineer who was capable of learning and adapting on the fly. After continuously proving herself to be an essential member of the crew, B’Elanna would eventually rise to the rank of chief engineer.

below_decks_ability.name: Knock it Down
below_decks_ability.bonus: {value} chance each round to apply Hull Breach to non-Player hostiles or Armada for 1 round.

captain_maneuver.name: Unfit To Lead
captain_maneuver.bonus: This Officer does not have a Captain's Maneuver. Equipping this Officer as the captain of a ship provides no benefit.

officer_ability.name: Me Against The Galaxy
officer_ability.bonus: When you take damage from a non-Player hostile or Armada, B'Elanna increases your Armor Piercing, Shield Piercing, and Accuracy by {value} of Attack for 1 round.
